name: 鄭鈺潔
objective: The purpose of this course is to understand the fundamental wave theory which describes how light propagates in the form of waves. During the 3-hour weekly practicals, we will be working in small teams on exercises and exploring some simulation tool to help with the material in the lectures. For example, we will introduce a sophisticated tool for studying the propagation of light, transmission of light through a medium, polarization, interference of waves and diffraction.
schedule:
1. The Wave Theory of Light
Maxwell’s equations. Complex representation. Phase and group velocity. Coherence superposition. Polarization.
2. Intereference
Wave splitting. Interference fringes. Dielectric films. Multiple-beam interference. Fabry-Perot interferometer .
3. Diffraction
Kirchhoff’s diffraction formula. Fresnel and Fraunhofer patterns for a single and double slit. Babinet’s principle. Diffraction gratings.
4. Coherence
Coherence function and degree of coherence. Stellar interferometry. Imagery. Lasers and holography.
